radiographic_examinations.findings: A large right hepatic lobe mass increased in size, measuring 8.4 x 6.7 cm; a previously seen right hepatic lobe mass increased in size, measuring 2.1 x 2.0 cm; new focal lesions in the right hepatic lobe and caudate lobe measuring 1.8 x 1.6 cm and 2.0 x 2.4 cm; bibasilar atelectasis; 7 mm nodule in the left lower lobe; mild intrahepatic biliary dilatation; diffuse dilation of the main pancreatic duct; subtle fat stranding around the pancreas raising the possibility of inflammation.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Progression of hepatic metastatic disease indicated by increase in size of hepatic masses; new 7 mm nodule in the left lower lobe compared to prior study.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Pneumobilia, no CBD dilation, persistent pancreatic duct dilation.
Persistent patchy right basilar opacity and small pleural effusion vs pleural thickening.
